intro: Piptolepis gardneri, commonly known as the California redshiner, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Piptolepis gardneri is often found in association with other native wildflowers in its ecological community.
